revised_title: Investigation of Diamond Fluorescence and its Spectral Properties
tldr: This study examines the fluorescence properties of various types of diamonds, focusing on the blue and green emission spectra. The authors use both photographic and photoelectric methods to analyze the fluorescence, finding that the 3650 A group of mercury lines excites fluorescence in all type I and type IIa diamonds, while type IIb specimens do not emit fluorescence with this wavelength. The results provide insights into the nature of the centers responsible for diamond fluorescence.
